author: g11tech
content: <@425572898787426305> could you see if this comment makes sense: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3653/files#r1555848580

author: m.kalinin
content: I suppose this check is implicitly done by `.index()` as it throws an exception in Python if the item is not found. I am in favour of making this check explicit cc <@415109946682769408> <@539495253418180618>

author: m.kalinin
content: And i agree that throwing an exception would be incorrect in this case. good catch!

author: g11tech
content: yea exeception throwing part would be the problem

author: lightclient
content:
updating 7002 to support maxeb partial withdrawals... currently the object is called `ExecutionLayerExit` -- what should it be called now that it can both exit and partial withdraw?

Current best is `ExecutionLayerWithdrawalRequest`  .... but that is sort of a mouthful
